intro: Nintooa canescens, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pale blue to purple, typically blooming in the early morning. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Nintooa canescens is often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
